description: The contract award and anticipated security requirements.
full_summary:
## Advance Procurement Notice for Geotechnical Consulting Services Standing Offer

### Overview

The Government of Canada, through Defence Construction Canada (DCC), is issuing an Advance Procurement Notice to alert interested consultants to the potential requirements for Geotechnical Consulting Services in Alberta, Saskatchewan, and Manitoba.

### Procurement Details

* Solicitation Number: WRO23SO1
* Tender Closing Date: July 18, 2023, at 16:00 ET
* Estimated Value: Approximately $2,000,000 over five (5) years
* Trade Agreements: Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA), Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA), and World Trade Organization Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO GPA)
* Regions of Opportunity: Canada
* Contracting Entity: Defence Construction Canada
* Anticipated Security Clearances: Designated Organization Screening (DOS) granted or approved by the Contract Security Program (CSP), Public Works and Government Services Canada (PWGSC)

### Services Description

The Government of Canada is seeking consultant expertise in Geotechnical services on an "as and when required" basis. The services may include:

* Arranging and supervising drilling of boreholes
* Performing subsurface Geotechnical Investigations and Analysis
* Conducting erosion control studies, analysis, and design
* Conducting drainage studies, analysis, and design
* Preparing and submitting Geotechnical reports

### Security Requirements

To be eligible for contract award, consultants must hold all required security clearances at the time of closing. The required security clearances are:

* Valid and active Designated Organization Screening (DOS) granted or approved by the CSP, PWGSC.

### Sponsorship Process

DCC is providing consultants with preliminary assistance for the security clearance sponsorship process. Consultants who do not actively hold the required security clearances should begin the sponsorship request process by applying through DCC's ISP. Interested consultants can access the sponsorship request application at https://www.dcc-cdc.gc.ca/industry/security-requirements.

### Contact Information

For any questions or inquiries, please contact:

* Sumbul Siddiqui, Coordinator, Contract Services, Defence Construction Canada: 587-635-1796, Sumbul.Siddiqui@dcc-cdc.gc.ca

Note: This entry has been rewritten to be more concise, clear, and professional, while keeping all relevant details. The original text has been condensed to 400 words, with improved formatting and structure for better readability
